SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.vector

Interface Vector

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
Quaternion, Vector2, Vector3, Vector4, Vector5, VectorX
public interface Vector extends Serializable
A one-dimensional array of numbers.

  • Method Details

    • of

      @Nonnull static Vector of(@Nonnull double... values)
      Creates a new vector from an array of component scalars.
      Parameters:
      values - Values to use
      Returns:
      Vector constructed from given values
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When at least one of the provided component scalars is non-finite

    • parseVector

      @Nonnull static Vector parseVector(@Nonnull String input) throws NumberFormatException
      Parses a vector into a string. Only direct subclasses of Vector are accounted for.
      Parameters:
      input - Input to parse into a vector
      Returns:
      The parsed vector
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - When the string does not represent a vector

    • values

      @Nonnull double[] values()
      Returns an array containing the component values of this vector.
      Returns:
      Array containing the components of this vector

    • length

      int length()
      Gets the length of this vector.
      Returns:
      The number of components in this vector

    • magnitude

      double magnitude()
      Gets the magnitude of this vector.
      Returns:
      The magnitude of this vector

    • magnitude2

      double magnitude2()
      Gets the squared magnitude of this vector.
      Returns:
      The squared magnitude of this vector

      Adds a scalar to this vector.

      Multiplies this vector by a scalar.

    • divide

      @Nonnull Vector divide(double s) throws ArithmeticException
      Divides this vector by a scalar.
      Parameters:
      s - Scalar to divide this vector by
      Returns:
      The resulting vector
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - When the denominator is zero

    • apply

      @Nonnull Vector apply(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Double> operator)
      Applies given operator to this vector, then returns the resulting vector.
      Parameters:
      operator - The operator to apply to all components of this vector
      Returns:
      The resulting vector

    • negate

      @Nonnull Vector negate()
      Returns the negated vector of this vector.
      Returns:
      The negated vector of this vector

    • normalize

      @Nonnull Vector normalize()
      Returns a normalized vector of this vector. If the magnitude of this vector is 0, the resulting vector will also have a magnitude of 0.
      Returns:
      The normalized vector of this vector
